name: KSI
description:
'''Olajide Olayinka Williams''' "'''JJ'''" '''Olatunji'''{{efn|''JJ'' is an abbreviation of "Jide Junior"—''Jide'' is a [[hypocorism]] of KSI's first name, ''Olajide''.}} ({{Pronunciation|Olajide_Olayinka_Williams_olatunji.wav}} born 19 June 1993), known professionally as '''KSI''',{{efn|''KSI'' is an abbreviation for "'''K'''nowledge '''S'''trength '''I'''ntegrity", which was derived from a [[Clan (video games)|clan]] he was a member of in the video game series ''[[Halo (franchise)|Halo]]''. His initial alias was '''KSIOlajidebt''', a compound of "KSI", his forename, and the initials of [[British Telecom]].}} is an English [[influencer]], musician, and former [[professional boxer]]. He is a co-founding member of [[YouTube]] group the [[Sidemen]], the co-founder of [[Misfits Boxing]] and co-owner of several businesses, including [[Prime (drink)|Prime Hydration]] and [[Lunchly]].

Born in [[London]] to parents of [[Yoruba people|Yoruba]] heritage and raised in [[Watford]], KSI was [[Public school (United Kingdom)|privately educated]] at [[Berkhamsted School]]. He registered his main YouTube channel ''KSI''—then known as ''KSIOlajidebt''—in 2009 and built a following through his [[Let's Play|commentary videos]] of the ''[[FIFA (video game series)|FIFA]]'' video game series. His content later diversified to include [[vlog]]s and comedic [[skits]]. In 2019, he was ranked second by ''[[The Sunday Times]]'' in its list of most influential online creators in the United Kingdom''.'' In 2021, he was listed in the ''Europe Entertainment'' category of [[Forbes 30 Under 30|''Forbes'' 30 Under 30]]; he was later ranked by ''[[Forbes]]'' as the second-top creator of 2023. As of January 2025, he has over 44 million subscribers and 14 billion video views across his three active YouTube channels.

Creating [[hip-hop]] music as early as 2011, he first achieved commercial success with "[[Lamborghini (song)|Lamborghini]]" (featuring [[P Money]]) in 2015. His debut [[EP]], ''[[Keep Up (EP)|Keep Up]]'' (2016), topped the [[UK R&B Albums Chart]]. He released his debut studio album, [[Dissimulation (KSI album)|''Dissimulation'']], in 2020, which peaked at number two on the [[UK Albums Chart]]. His second studio album, [[All Over the Place (KSI album)|''All Over the Place'']] (2021), debuted at number one and was [[certified platinum]] by the [[British Phonographic Industry|BPI]]; its lead singles "[[Don't Play]]" (with [[Anne-Marie]] and [[Digital Farm Animals]]) and  "[[Holiday (KSI song)|Holiday]]" both debuted at number two on the [[UK Singles Chart]] and were nominated for [[Brit Award for Song of the Year|Song of the Year]] at the [[Brit Awards]]. He has achieved fourteen top 40 singles in the United Kingdom, with seven peaking in the top 10. He received the [[Brit Billion Award]] in 2024, for amassing over one billion [[Music streaming service|music streams]] in the United Kingdom. He also starred in the [[direct-to-video]] comedy film ''[[Laid in America]]'' (2016), and has been the subject of multiple documentaries, including [[Amazon Prime Video]]'s ''[[KSI: In Real Life|In Real Life]]'' (2023).

He was involved in a [[White-collar boxing|white-collar boxing match]] against Joe Weller in February 2018. Two further boxing events against American YouTuber [[Logan Paul]] took place, the second of which was a [[Professional boxing|professional bout]] in which he won via [[split decision]] in [[KSI vs. Logan Paul II|November 2019]]. In [[KSI vs Swarmz & Luis Alcaraz Pineda|August 2022]], he fought two people in the same night, defeating rapper [[Swarmz]] and professional boxer Luis Alcaraz Pineda. In 2023, he fought [[FaZe Temperrr]] in [[KSI vs FaZe Temperrr|January]], [[Joe Fournier]] in [[KSI vs Joe Fournier|May]], and [[Tommy Fury]] in [[KSI vs Tommy Fury|October]], which he lost via [[unanimous decision]]. He announced his retirement from boxing in January 2026.
